Post: "I can't believe Twitter changed its reply system again! It's like they're trying to make it impossible for me to communicate effectively. I swear, I'm just cursed when it comes to technology."

Event: Being sick with no one to care for me.

"I did bad things because I'm inherently flawed and lack any sense of morality."

Sure, I understand the definition of Internal Attributional Style (IAS) and how it refers to attributing causes to personal characteristics or factors rather than external circumstances. I'm ready to generate a social media post using the IAS format based on the event you provide. Please go ahead and provide the event.

"I can't believe I'm stuck with this annoying hay fever. Must be because I'm allergic to everything or maybe it's just my weak immune system. Why can't I just be normal for once?" #IAS #InternalAttributionalStyle
"I've been trying to change my habit of procrastination for weeks now, but it's like I'm stuck in a rut. Maybe it's because I'm just not cut out for this whole 'adulting' thing."

"Missed my chance because I'm just not good enough."
"I'm so disappointed that I missed the Indiana show. It's just typical of me to mess up and miss out on these kinds of opportunities. I guess I'll never be as successful as my peers."
